remarks: If two structures have the same components (properties), one is a pre-Hilbert space iff the other one is.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Oct-2015.)
statement:
phlpropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
phlpropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
phlpropd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
phlpropd.4 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( Scalar ` K ) ) $.
phlpropd.5 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( Scalar ` L ) ) $.
phlpropd.6 $e |- P = ( Base ` F ) $.
phlpropd.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .s ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .s ` L ) y ) ) $.
phlpropd.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .i ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .i ` L ) y ) ) $.
phlpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( K e. PreHil <-> L e. PreHil ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d F x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d ph x y $.
